cards.title: The Simurgh
setup: Put {TheSimurghCharacter} into play, 'Endbringer Strategist' side up. Set all Condition cards aside as the Condition deck. Shuffle all Trap cards and put the top {H} into play face down. Remove the other Trap cards from the game.
gameplay: At the start of the villain turn, play the top card of the Condition deck. Then, reveal the top {H - 1} cards of the villain deck. Put the revealed cards back in ascending order of {SimurghDanger}.
At the end of the villain turn, {TheSimurghCharacter} deals the hero with the highest HP {H - 1} projectile damage. Then, if there are no face-down villain cards, flip this card.
advanced: At the start of the villain turn, play the top card of the Condition deck.
flippedGameplay: At the start of the villain turn, reveal the top {H + 1} cards of the villain deck. Put the revealed cards back in ascending order of {SimurghDanger}.
At the end of the villain turn, put a token on this card. Then, each hero target deals itself X psychic damage, where X is the number of tokens on this card.
flippedAdvanced: Players may not discuss strategy or tactics.

cards.title: A Backup Sabotaged
body: If any hero has 2 cards in hand with the same name, flip a face-down villain card and remove this card from the game.
Otherwise, shuffle this card into the Condition deck.
cards.flavorText: The heroes had cut the power, and the Simurgh was still managing to activate the thing.

cards.title: A Capability Revealed
body: Destroy all Equipment cards. Reveal the top X cards of the villain deck, where X is the number of cards destroyed this way. Put the revealed cards back in ascending order of {SimurghDanger}.
cards.flavorText: Pieces of machinery began to flow out of a gaping hole in the side of the building nearest where she'd landed, stopping when they reached her immediate vicinity.

cards.title: A Countermeasure Defeated
body: Reveal the top {H} cards of the villain trash. Play the revealed card with the lowest {SimurghDanger}.
cards.flavorText: Telekinesis. She'd created a false image of herself out of snow and ice, baiting Scion away.

cards.title: A Crucial Hesitation
body: When this card is flipped face up, put {8 - H} tokens on it. If this card ever has no tokens on it, the heroes lose the game.
At the end of the villain turn, remove a token from this card.
Whenever a hero skips 2 phases of the same turn, put a token on this card.
This card is indestructible.
cards.flavorText: The bubble-man formed another shield around himself, but he left his companion out of it.

cards.title: A Defense Penetrated
body: Damage that would be dealt to hero targets cannot be redirected.
This card is indestructible.
cards.flavorText: The resulting shards and flakes of crystal turned around in the air and condensed in a thick shell around the force field.

cards.title: A Fate Selected
body: {TheSimurghCharacter} deals the hero with the fewest cards in play {H} sonic damage.
cards.flavorText: The result is hallucinations, momentary or sustained. Hearing sounds, seeing things, smelling something, where none truly exist.

cards.title: A Million Coincidences
body: The environment deals 1 hero target 1 projectile damage. Repeat this effect [3/5/7] times for {H} = [3/4/5].
The environment deals 1 hero target 1 irreducible projectile damage. Repeat this effect [3/8/15] times for {H} = [3/4/5].
cards.flavorQuotes: Not one second after the barrier was in place, a pair of heroes flew around the corner.

cards.title: A Plan Enacted
body: If there are {H} face-up Trap cards, play the top card of the villain deck.
Otherwise, flip a face-down villain card, then shuffle this card into the villain deck.
cards.flavorText: He glanced over his shoulder, saw the various components of the circle crackling with current as it rose behind the Simurgh, like a gargantuan halo.

cards.title: A Reckoning Long Delayed
body: When this card is flipped face up, each player secretly chooses a hero, then all players reveal their choices simultaneously. If one hero has more votes than any other, that hero deals themself 5 psychic damage. Otherwise, each hero deals themself 5 psychic damage.
This card is indestructible.
cards.flavorText: An obstacle must be removed. This is critical, but she is blind to it. This is the greatest problem she faces.

cards.title: A Response Prepared
body: When this card is revealed, play it.
Destroy all hero Ongoing cards.
cards.flavorText: Pretercognition. Spread out over several targets at once. Each target is conceptualized in the context of twelve to eighty years of history.

cards.title: A Strength Turned to Weakness
body: Whenever a hero target would deal more than {8 - H} damage, that target first deals itself 1 melee damage.
This card is indestructible.

flavorQuotes.text: It's going to backfire. I've said it before, I'll say it now, and I'll remind you all I said it with every chance I get until the day I die. It's going to backfire.

cards.title: A Surfeit of Options
body: If there are at least {H} Ongoing cards in play, flip a face-down villain card and remove this card from the game.
Otherwise, shuffle this card into the Condition deck.
cards.flavorText: She requires resources. This requires patience.

cards.title: A Terrible Defeat
body: When this card is flipped face up, each player secretly chooses a hero, then all players reveal their choices simultaneously. If one hero has more votes than any other, destroy all of that hero's non-character cards. Otherwise, destroy all hero non-character cards.
This card is indestructible.
cards.flavorText: The indistinct and distant noises of the heroes firing on the Simurgh had stopped all at once, as the heroes were killed or left reeling from the aftershock.

cards.title: A Threat Foreseen
body: The first time {TheSimurghCharacter} would be dealt damage each round, redirect that damage to the hero with the lowest HP.
cards.flavorQuotes: Possibilities, as another jumble of images. These clarify as the others do, as eventualities are discarded, the targets around her coming into focus.

cards.title: A Tragic End
body: When this card is flipped face up, destroy all non-character card targets. {TheSimurghCharacter} deals each hero target X projectile damage, where X is the number of targets destroyed this way.
This card is indestructible.
cards.flavorText: A tide of snow and ice hit him like a truck, driving him into the ragged edge of the building.

cards.title: A Wealth of Targets
body: If there are at least {H} non-character card targets in play, flip a face-down villain card and remove this card from the game.
Otherwise, shuffle this card into the Condition deck.
cards.flavorText: With study and precision, each ball can find its pocket. Spheres of resin meet a ledge covered by wool, perching on the edge as they spend their momentum.

cards.title: An Ambush Laid
body: When this card is revealed, play it.
{TheSimurghCharacter} deals each hero target X fire damage, where X is the number of face-up Trap cards plus 1.
cards.flavorText: The various fragments, the little things, the bodies and pieces of furniture, they became part of a protective maelstrom around the Simurgh.

cards.title: An Attack Expected
body: If {TheSimurghCharacter} was dealt damage last round, flip a face-down villain card and remove this card from the game.
Otherwise, shuffle this card into the Condition deck.
cards.flavorText: She must be unmolested. This is given freely to her.

cards.title: An Environment Chosen
body: Play the top {H} cards of the environment deck.
cards.flavorText: Frame a situation to put a target under optimal fear and stress. Hormone secretions increase.

cards.title: An Unfortunate Malfunction
body: If there are at least {H} Equipment cards in play, flip a face-down villain card and remove this card from the game.
Otherwise, shuffle this card into the Condition deck.
cards.flavorText: She requires access to particular information. This can be arranged by positioning targets carefully.

cards.title: An Unpleasant Discovery
body: At the start of the villain turn, name a keyword. Reveal the top 2 cards of each hero deck. Replace each card with the named keyword and discard the rest.
Whenever a hero card is discarded, that hero deals themself 1 psychic damage.
This card is indestructible.

flavorQuotes.text: If she's answering questions for us, we don't want to know.
